welcomeMessage: Hi **@chauler**, how can I help you?

response.value:
Snippet with error: `<marquee>Ticket Booking System</marquee>`
Location of error: Inside the `<header>` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 2.2.2 Pause, Stop, Hide (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Checking for deprecated HTML elements that could cause distraction or difficulty in understanding content.
Explanation of Error: The `<marquee>` tag is deprecated and it creates content that moves or auto-updates that can be a distraction and might not be accessible to all users. It's recommended to replace it with more modern and accessible techniques.

---

Snippet with error: `<label for="event"></label>`
Location of error: Inside the `<form>` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Checking for labels that are associated with form controls but do not contain any text.
Explanation of Error: The label for the "event" select menu is empty. Labels should provide descriptive text for form controls to assist users in filling out the form.

---

Snippet with error: `<input type="number" alt="quantity" id="quantity" name="quantity" min="1" required>`
Location of error: Inside the `<form>` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Checking for incorrect attributes on form elements.
Explanation of Error: The `alt` attribute is not valid for `input` elements. If you want to provide a description, use the `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby` attribute instead.

---

Snippet with error: `<button type="button" onclick="submitForm()" style="background-color: #45a049;">`
Location of error: Inside the `<form>` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 3.2.2 On Input (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Checking for form submission handled by JavaScript.
Explanation of Error: The form is submitted using JavaScript. This can create issues for users who have JavaScript disabled or are using assistive technologies. It's recommended to use a submit button (`<button type="submit">`) and handle form submission on the server side.

followups.message: What are some alternative techniques to replace the deprecated `<marquee>` tag for creating moving content?

b.description: Ask Copilot or type / for commands

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:
metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).

b.name: GitHub Copilot

Snippet with error: `Home` Location of error: Inside the `
` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context) (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking for links that have no href attribute or a non-descriptive href attribute. Explanation of Error: The links in the navigation have a non-descriptive href attribute (`#`). This can be confusing for users who rely on screen readers or other assistive technologies. Each link's href attribute should be unique and descriptive of its destination. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: `` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 1.4.3 Contrast (Minimum) (Level AA) Detection Algorithm: Checking for low contrast between text color and background color. Explanation of Error: The body text color is white (`#fff`) and the background image might not provide sufficient contrast for this text color. This can make the text hard to read for users with low vision or color vision deficiencies. Ensure that there is sufficient contrast between text color and background color. --- Snippet with error: `

Snippet with error: `` Location of error: At the start of the HTML document WCAG Guideline violated: 3.1.1 Language of Page (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking if the language of the page is defined. Explanation of Error: The language of the page is set to English. If the content is not in English, this can cause issues for screen readers and other assistive technologies. Ensure that the language attribute matches the language of the page content. --- Snippet with error: `

Book Your Tickets

` Location of error: Inside the `
` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking for headings that do not follow a logical order. Explanation of Error: The document starts with a level 2 heading, skipping the level 1 heading. This can be confusing for users who rely on screen readers or other assistive technologies. Ensure that headings follow a logical order, starting with a level 1 heading. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: Inside the `
` tag WCAG Guideline violated: 3.3.2 Labels or Instructions (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking for form controls that do not have associated labels. Explanation of Error: The text input for the user's name does not have an associated label. Labels provide descriptive text for form controls to assist users in filling out the form. --- Snippet with error: `` Location of error: At the end of the HTML document WCAG Guideline violated: 2.1.1 Keyboard (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking for scripts that might interfere with keyboard navigation. Explanation of Error: The script hides the form and shows a confirmation message after form submission. This change in content might not be accessible for keyboard-only users. Ensure that all functionality can be accessed using the keyboard.

followups.message: What are some best practices for improving accessibility in HTML?

To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
